summary: Federal nutrition guidelines are the basis for nutrition assistance programs that serve older adults. However, the guidelines focus on a healthy population and not on the needs of many older adults, such as those with common health conditions and those over age 70. Most older adults have more than one chronic condition, such as diabetes or heart disease. As the population ages, demand for federal...
title: Nutrition Assistance Programs: Agencies Could Do More to Help Address the Nutritional Needs of Older Adults
